definitions.definition: a small bag made of very thin rubber that becomes larger and rounder when you fill it with air or gas. Balloons are brightly coloured and used as decorations or toys.

examples.text: A thousand balloons were released to mark the event.
They tied the balloons to the back of the car.
helium balloons for the children's party

definitions.definition: a large balloon made of strong material that is filled with hot air or gas to make it rise in the air, usually carrying a basket for passengers

examples.text: We went up in a balloon.
She crossed the Atlantic in a hot-air balloon.

definitions.definition: to be very unsuccessful; to not be accepted by people

examples.text: My suggestion went down like a lead balloon.

definitions.definition: when the trouble that you are expecting begins

examples.text: We have to get out of here before the balloon goes up!

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (originally denoting a game played with a large inflated leather ball): from French ballon or Italian ballone ‘large ball’.
